授業目的: The primary goal of this course is to provide students with a conceptual framework for identifying and resolving accounting issues faced by managers. The secondary purpose of this course is to help increase students’ quantitative skill by dealing with several exercises and problems on the classification of cost, CVP analysis, accumulating and assessing costs to products, measuring and managing customer relationships and process performance, budgets for planning and coordination, and financial control.
到達目標: After the completion of the course, students will be able to use accounting information for decision-making, performance evaluation, and control. Besides, they will learn some behavioral and organizational issues in management accounting and control system.The course is useful for the students who intend to work as management consultants or management accountants of manufacturing companies.
授業方法: The course will be offered in a face-to-face format. Course pedagogy includes lectures on topics followed by case studies to illustrate and reinforce concepts. Students are expected to have read and prepped, within groups, the assigned problem prior to attending the face-to-face class. The textbook will be used to pick up the conceptual tools to prep for each case. The instructor will supply all the reading materials in advance. Please note that if the Covid situation worsens again and any international students are unable to enter the country (or unable to leave their home country), the instructor will offer a hybrid online class. Before the first class, the instructor will send students the lecture power points and reading materials.
